div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE
No. 7,423 7,423] ALEXANDRIA, MONDAY, FEBRUARY 19, 1906. [EIGHT PAGES P.T. 1.
The Eastern Telegraph Company, Limited.
div.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).

Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSOWAH, HODBIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIN direct. Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required.
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency.

div.head: Austrian Lloyd’s Steam Navigation
div.p: Alexandria-Brindisi-Trieste (Venice).

Weekly Express Mail Service. Steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 4 p.m. arrive at Brindisi, Tuesday 5 a.m. in time for express to Milan, Lucerne, Paris, Vienna, Berlin, and London, leaving Brindisi 7 a.m. Arrival Trieste Wednesday about 11 a.m. in connection with Train de Luxe Trieste-Vienna-Ostende. Passengers reach London every Friday 4.50 p.m.
Fortnightly Service: Alexandria-Brindisi & Trieste Line.

div.head: THE SUCRERIES GO.
CONCORDAT GRANTED.
SATURDAY’S MEETING OF CREDITORS.
div.p: The creditors of the Société des Sucreries et de la Raffinerie o'Egypte met oi Saturday after- noon at 3 o'clock. Judge Tack presided over the meeting, which was held at the Mixed Courts, assisted by MM. Zighara ana Chiarai-oli. Toe principal mere beta of the Cairo Bar were there with the Hon. A. J. Davey, M. Naas, and other members of the company.

At the opening of toe proceedings Me. Carton de Wiart informed the judge that alt the credi¬tors had agreed to accept a slight modification on the proposals already submitted to the Court. M. Zighara then read a letter from Me. Courceiie, *ho protested most spiritedly against the gianting of the concordat preveuttf and demanded the prosecution of all the directors except the Hon. A. J. Davey.

However, as Me. Conroeile only represented 85 shares the majority swept his protest aside, end Me carton de W lart laid before the' Coart the minutes of the arrangement adopted as to the concordat with the signatures of the credi¬tors, and with it the oonvcntiou of the Daira Sugar Compauy and the Suoiertes.
The voting followed, with this result : for the granting uf the cunoordat, 64,2x5 votes, representing L. E. 2,267,11s ; against, 199 votes, representing In E. 4
Tue yroce't verbal was signe i at 6 p. m. and the Sucreries Company opened a new chapter in its history. May it end happily.
The confirmation of the arrangement will take place on Saturday next

div.head: LOCAL AND GENERAL
div.p: Pasteur Institute.
The Government has appointed a German bacteriologist, Dr. Ernest Meinicke, to manage the Pasteur Institute at Cairo.
The late King of Denmark.

Tue Dead March in •‘haul” was played at St. Mark’s and All Saints' Churches, and the flag at the British Consulate floated half-mast high yesterday as it was the day of the funeral of King Christian IX.
Boy Drowned.

Our Suet Correspondent writes: — last Thursday, owing to the southerly gale at Suet, three lighters laden with coal sunk, one if which, in the Bitter Lake, turned over, and a native boy was drowned. His body was not yet been recovered.
Cairo’s New Bridge.

The Abba, Bridge will have a drawbridge in the centre for the passage of vessels. But there will i e a footbridge, which will allow pedestrians to cross even when the draw bridge is up, as is the case the Tower Bridge in London.
Custom House Porters’ Cate.

We are asked to correct the statemen which appeared under the above heading on Thursday. Mr. Stagni ie not in litigation with the Custom House Porters’ Society but with the Socite de seoour mutuel de Portefaix d'Altxandne (i.e., the Town Porters’ Society;-
